Package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day1

Class Trebuchet

java.lang.Object
com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day1.Trebuchet
public class Trebuchet extends Object
Implements solutions for parts 1 and 2 of day 1—that is, reading and analyzes a sequence of lines of text, extracting a 2-digit integer comprising the first and last digits that appear in the line from each, and then summing those numbers.

Parts 1 and 2 of the problem differ in what qualifies as a digit:

  • In part 1, the only digits recognized are the characters 0..9 from the base-10 Indo-Arabic numerals. The method using this rule is sumDigits().
  • In part 2, the digit characters 0..9 are recognized, along with the words spelling them out: "zero", "one", "two", "three", etc. The method employing this relaxed definition is sumDigitWords().

In both cases, the first and last digits aren't necessarily distinct. For example, in a line comprising simply "9", 9 is both the first digit and the last digit; the resulting 2-digit number for that line would be 99. Similarly, digit words (in part 2) may overlap. For example in the line "oneight", the first digit is 1, represented by the word "one", and the last is 8, represented by "eight".

See Also:
  • "Day 1: Trebuchet?!".

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Trebuchet()
    Initializes this instance, using the value of DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read.
    Trebuchet(String inputFile)
    Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the inputFile parameter as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    Creates an instance of Trebuchet for each of the two parts of the problem, implicitly specifying that input should be read from the file specified in DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE, and invoking the relevant method to compute the required value, which is then printed to the console.
    int
    sumDigits()
    Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE if the Trebuchet() constructor is used), extracts the first digit found in the line (reading left-to-right) and the last digit found (or the first found, reading right-to-left), combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns the sum of these.
    int
    sumDigitWords()
    Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE if the Trebuchet() constructor is used), extracts the first digit character or digit word found in the line (reading left-to-right) and the last digit character or digit word found (or the first found, reading right-to-left), combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns the sum of these.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Trebuchet

      public Trebuchet()
      Initializes this instance, using the value of DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read. In other words, using this constructor is equivalent to using Trebuchet(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE).

    • Trebuchet

      public Trebuchet(String inputFile)
      Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the inputFile parameter as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - Classpath/package-relative location of file from which input is read.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      Creates an instance of Trebuchet for each of the two parts of the problem, implicitly specifying that input should be read from the file specified in DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE, and invoking the relevant method to compute the required value, which is then printed to the console.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
      Throws:
      IOException - If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor invocation cannot be found or read.

    • sumDigits

      public int sumDigits() throws IOException
      Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE if the Trebuchet() constructor is used), extracts the first digit found in the line (reading left-to-right) and the last digit found (or the first found, reading right-to-left), combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns the sum of these.

      This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.

      Returns:
      The sum of two-digit numbers extracted from the input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor invocation cannot be found or read.

    • sumDigitWords

      public int sumDigitWords() throws IOException
      Reads each line of the input file (as specified in the constructor invocation, or DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE if the Trebuchet() constructor is used), extracts the first digit character or digit word found in the line (reading left-to-right) and the last digit character or digit word found (or the first found, reading right-to-left), combines them to form a two-digit integer, and returns the sum of these.

      This method does not modify the state of the instance or have any other side effects.

      Returns:
      The sum of two-digit numbers extracted from the input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the input file specified (implicitly or explicitly) in the constructor invocation cannot be found or read.
